Package server.model

Class ProgrammerHandler

java.lang.Object
server.model.agents.ProgrammerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ProgrammerHandler extends Object implements Serializable
Handles the drone controller, like an API. Mostly helper functions to pass throughout the intricacies of the code structure and convert things to more easily understandable formats
See Also:
Serialized Form

    ProgrammerHandler.Position
    We use an internal class to make handling positional information easier.

  • Constructor Details

    • ProgrammerHandler

      public ProgrammerHandler​(server.model.AgentProgrammed connectedAgent)
      Constructor. Connects the agent to the programmer s.t. this class behaves akin to an MVC controller
      Parameters:
      connectedAgent - The agent that this handler controls

    • completeTask

      protected void completeTask()
      Completes the task currently set. Also sends this completion message to the network automatically, and adds it to the set of tasks that it will report as complete from now on

    • completeTask

      Returns:
      Neighbours as a list of coordinates

    • getNeighboursAsRelativeCoords

      protected List<server.model.Coordinate> getNeighboursAsRelativeCoords​(double radius)
      Senses all other agents within the given radius, and returns their locations relative to this agent
      Parameters:
      radius - The radius to check within
      Returns:
      Neighbours as a list of coordinates, relative to this agent

    • printNeighbours

      public void printNeighbours()
      Just for diagnostics. Prints the neighbours of this agent to the log

    • declareSelf

      public void declareSelf​(int radius)
      Declares this agent to its neighbours. Sends its full positional information (to the best of its knowledge), and, if it has a current task assigned, shares that too.
      Parameters:
      radius - the radius to broadcast too

    • broadcast

      protected void broadcast​(String message, int radius)
      Broadcasts the given message (in a standard format) to the network across a given radius
      Parameters:
      message - The message to send
      radius - The range of communication

    • receiveMessage

      protected void receiveMessage​(String message)
      The main communication protocol. Handles the given message, in a form of operator and operands, then acts on the given information
      Parameters:
      message - The entire message given

    • sendDiagnosticMessage

      protected void sendDiagnosticMessage​(String targetID, String message)
      Sends a message to a given NetworkID that will be printed in the log. Mostly for diagnostics etc
      Parameters:
      targetID - The NetworkID to send to
      message - The message to send

    • getTasks

      public HashMap<List<server.model.Coordinate>,​List<String>> getTasks()
      The list of tasks. This is an unusual hashmap format: Key = Task (by list of coordinates, usually a singleton) Entry = (List of Strings) NetworkIDs of agents working on this task
      Returns:
      tasks

    • getNearestTask

      public List<server.model.Coordinate> getNearestTask()
      Get the nearest task known
      Returns:
      nearest task

    • getNearestEmptyTask

      public List<server.model.Coordinate> getNearestEmptyTask()
      Get the nearest known task that has no agents assigned to it yet
      Returns:
      The nearest task with no agents assigned

    • calculateAverageNeighbourHeading

      public double calculateAverageNeighbourHeading​(boolean includeStationary)
      Calculates the average heading of all known neighbours
      Parameters:
      includeStationary - Whether to include agents that are stationary (usually you don't want to, as they aren't doing anything)
      Returns:
      Average heading of neighbours

    • calculateAverageNeighbourHeading

      public double calculateAverageNeighbourHeading()
      Default handler for this method, assumes you don't want to include stationary agents
      Returns:
      Average heading of neighbours

    • setTask

      public void setTask​(List<server.model.Coordinate> taskCoords)
      Sets this agents task to the given coordinate set
      Parameters:
      taskCoords - The coordinates of this task

    • getAgentsAssigned

      protected List<String> getAgentsAssigned​(List<server.model.Coordinate> task)
      Gets the list of all agents (by network id) assigned ot the given task
      Parameters:
      task - The task to check
      Returns:
      The list of NetworkIDs for the agents assigned

    • tempPlaceNewTask

      protected void tempPlaceNewTask​(String type, List<server.model.Coordinate> coords)
      Unused currently; This is a clumsy way of adding tasks from the programmer. It does work, but the receiver method is better
      Parameters:
      type - Type of task
      coords - Task's coordinate

    • hasNeighbours

      public boolean hasNeighbours()
      Returns whether this agent has any known neighbours
      Returns:
      if this agnet has neighbours

      public int getNumberOfNeighbours()
      Returns the number of neighbours this drone has
      Returns:
      Number of neighbours

    • clearNeighbours

      public void clearNeighbours()
      Clears the list of neighbours

    • addTask

      protected void addTask​(server.model.task.Task item)
      This shouldn't be used by controller, as it handles Task objects. You can create tasks as coordinate lists and use the TempPlaceTask, or you can set a route for an agent, but probably best not to use this. Adds a task to this agent. Passed through to receivers, when adding tasks from the user
      Parameters:
      item - Task to add

    • flockWithAttractionRepulsion

      protected void flockWithAttractionRepulsion()
      Uses the pre-existing flocking algorithm based on attraction and repulsion

    • isReceiver

      protected boolean isReceiver()
      Checks whether this agent is a receiver of tasks
      Returns:
      If it is a receiver

    • getAverageNeighbourSpeed

      public double getAverageNeighbourSpeed()
      Gets average movement based on if agents are stopped or moving, NOT their "speed" stat as that doesn't change
      Returns:
      Average movement

    • checkForNeighbourMovement

      protected boolean checkForNeighbourMovement()
      Checks whether any neighbours are moving. This is the easiest way to stop them flying off at the start
      Returns:
      Whether any neighbours are moving

    • sendCustomMessage

      public void sendCustomMessage​(String opCode, String payload)
      Allows the programmer to handle custom messages that may be passed through normally
      Parameters:
      opCode - A code to allow you to differentiate messages for different functionalities
      payload - The useful part of the message you want to handle

      public String getRandomNeighbour()

      public boolean checkNeighbourHasTask​(String key)

    • setLeaderVisual

      public void setLeaderVisual​(boolean leader)
